request_pathways.name: Authorization to Use and Disclose PHI (hospital form)
Authorization to Use and Disclose Health Information (physician network form)

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Patients are directed to a Swellbox/Datavant online portal for record requests, with a downloadable generic HIPAA authorization PDF available as an alternative.

red_flags: Liability release clause on form-1 releasing hospital from legal responsibility for disclosures
Social Security Number requested on form-2
Forms severely outdated (2013 and pre-2010 respectively)
Template merge fields visible on public PDF (unprocessed internal template)
bright_spots: Swellbox/Datavant online portal available for patient record requests
Dedicated medical records page with clear navigation and multiple access options
Granular record-type checkboxes (14+ options) for patient control over disclosure scope
Form-2 offers granular opt-in for seven categories of highly confidential information

findability.rationale: Level 4: Easy to find with basic navigation — the medical records page is clearly linked and a web search immediately returns results, though the form is not prominently featured on the homepage.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 4: Mostly digital — the Swellbox/Datavant online portal provides a digital submission pathway, but the downloadable PDF forms have zero fillable fields and are entirely print-and-fill.

content_design.rationale: Level 3: Adequate but has notable problems — the form has logical section headers and good record-type granularity, but uses moderately legalistic language, displays confusing template merge fields, and contains a typo in legal attestation text.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 3: A patient can use the process but it wasn't designed for them — the PDF form is a generic third-party authorization with a 'Self' checkbox rather than a dedicated patient access form, though the Swellbox portal offers a somewhat more patient-oriented alternative.

compliance.rationale: Level 4: Minor ambiguities but nothing that would materially impede a patient — proper revocation rights and non-conditioning disclosures are present, though the liability release clause and SSN request on form-2 are unnecessary requirements.

overall.summary: Piedmont Medical Center provides a functional records request experience with a Swellbox portal and easy-to-find medical records page, but is held back by outdated, non-fillable PDF forms and a generic authorization approach that doesn't center patient self-access.
